alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Rusk; San Augustine; Shelby (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:30AM CDT until May 02 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno affecting Rusk, Nacogdoches, San Augustine and Shelby Counties. For the Attoyac Bayou...including Chireno...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Attoyac Bayou Near Chireno. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Expect lowland flooding for the next several days of the heavily wooded floodplain. Ranchers that have cattle and equipment near the river should move them to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 12/19/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 700 AM CDT.
